en: After this opened Job his mouth, and cursed his day.
hmr: Chu hnunga chun Job chun a bau a kah a, a pieng ni chu ṭawngsie ân phur tah a.

en: And Job answered and said:
hmr: Chun, Job chun a hril tah a:

en: Let the day perish wherein I was born, And the night which said, There is a man-child conceived.
hmr: “Ni, ka piengna ni chu bohmang sienla, ‘Naupasal pâi a nih ie,’ titu zân le chun.

en: Let that day be darkness; Let not God from above seek for it, Neither let the light shine upon it.
hmr: Chu ni chu sukthimin um sienla, Chungtienga inthawkin Pathien khawmin ngaisak naw sienla; A chungah var khawm var bawk naw raw se.

en: Let darkness and the shadow of death claim it for their own; Let a cloud dwell upon it; Let all that maketh black the day terrify it.
hmr: Inthimna le thina hlim chun anni ta ngeiah hau sienla, A chungah sûm zîng tlat raw se; Ni inthimna chun suklâu raw hai se.

en: As for that night, let thick darkness seize upon it: Let it not rejoice among the days of the year; Let it not come into the number of the months.
hmr: Chu zân chu inthim sâmupin man sienla, Chu kum sûng nihaia chun hlimna hrim hrim um naw sienla; Thla nizât tiemnaa khawm ṭhang ve naw raw se.

en: Lo, let that night be barren; Let no joyful voice come therein.
hmr: Anih, chu zân chu zân dawkdâium ni sienla, Chu zâna chun hlim râwl hrim hrim um naw raw se.

en: Let them curse it that curse the day, Who are ready to rouse up leviathan.
hmr: Ni ṭawngsie inphurtuhai chun ṭawngsie inphur raw se, Leviathan sukhar dân thiemhai chun.

en: Let the stars of the twilight thereof be dark: Let it look for light, but have none; Neither let it behold the eyelids of the morning:
hmr: A sîkhawvar chu inthim sienla, Var zawng sienla, hmu bawk naw sienla; Zîngkâr khawfingchat khawm hmu bawk naw raw se.

en: Because it shut not up the doors of my mother’s womb, Nor hid trouble from mine eyes.
hmr: Ka nu sula kawtkhârhai chu a lo khâr nawh a, Ka mithaia inthawkin buoina chu a thup naw bawk leiin.

en: Why died I not from the womb? Why did I not give up the ghost when my mother bare me?
hmr: Sula chun iengdinga ka lo thi naw am a na? Phîng sûnga inthawka ka hung suokin iengdinga thlarau chu lo inthla el naw am ka na?

en: Why did the knees receive me? Or why the breasts, that I should suck?
hmr: Khûphai chun iengdinga an mi lo dawm am a na? Nênehai chun ka nêk ding elin iengdinga an mi lo pawm am a na?

en: For now should I have lain down and been quiet; I should have slept; then had I been at rest,
hmr: Tuhin zâlin to riem riem tâng ka ta, In ka ta, sâwldamin ka um ta ding bah:

en: With kings and counsellors of the earth, Who built up waste places for themselves;
hmr: Hi hnuoia lalhai le rorêltuhai, Anni ta dinga hmun sehai siemtuhai le chun;

en: Or with princes that had gold, Who filled their houses with silver:
hmr: Annawleh, lal nau rângkachak neituhai, An inhai tangkaruoa suksiptuhai le chun.

en: Or as a hidden untimely birth I had not been, As infants that never saw light.
hmr: Annawleh, pieng hun loa thupa um ang ka ni ta ding, Nautê, var hrim hrim hmu ngailohai ang hi.

en: There the wicked cease from troubling; And there the weary are at rest.
hmr: Chutaka chun mi rilo chun a sukbuoina chu ma tâng a ta, Chutaka chun rimsi chu sâwldam tâng a tih.

en: There the prisoners are at ease together; They hear not the voice of the taskmaster.
hmr: Chutaka chun lung in intânghai chu um khâwm dingin an zalên a; Sin inthâwtirtu râwlri khawm an hriet ta ngai nawh.

en: The small and the great are there: And the servant is free from his master.
hmr: Mi lien le mi chîn khawm chutaka chun an um khâwm a; Siehlaw khawm chu a hotua inthawk inthla a ni tah.

en: Wherefore is light given to him that is in misery, And life unto the bitter in soul;
hmr: Iengdinga mi, rimsitaka um kuoma chun var pêk a nih a, Lungrila rimsi tuor kuoma chun hringna pêk am a nih a?

en: Who long for death, but it cometh not, And dig for it more than for hid treasures;
hmr: Thi inhâwk êm êma thi thei si lo a, Ro phûm zawng nêk hmana zawng nasa a,

en: Who rejoice exceedingly, And are glad, when they can find the grave?
hmr: Thlân chu a hmu suok thei pha a, Nasataka hlim êm êm ding kuoma chun?

en: Why is light given to a man whose way is hid, And whom God hath hedged in?
hmr: Iengdinga mi, a lampui thupa um kuoma le, Pathienin paldâi ân huonkhum kuoma chun var pêk am a na?

en: For my sighing cometh before I eat, And my groanings are poured out like water.
hmr: Ka bufâk hmain ka thuokdawngna chu a hung tlung a, Kân rûmnahai chu tui anga bunthlâk an ni hlak sih a.

en: For the thing which I fear cometh upon me, And that which I am afraid of cometh unto me.
hmr: Thil ka iṭi tak chu ka chungah a hung tlung hlak a, Ka înlâu tak chu ka kuomah a hung tlung hlak.

en: I am not at ease, neither am I quiet, neither have I rest; But trouble cometh.
hmr: Inhawiin ka um nawh a, ka to ṭawk ṭawk thei nawh a, Sâwldam ka nei bawk nawh a; buoina a hung tlung lem hlak,” tiin.
